Swedish Organization Protests Japan's Repression of Chongryon
articles.content:
Swedish Organization Protests Japan's Repression of Chongryon 
    Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- The Sweden-Korea Friendship Association on Mar. 31 sent a protest letter to the Japanese embassy in Stockholm as regards the fact that the Japanese authorities are becoming evermore undisguised in the suppression of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and Koreans in Japan.
 The letter said that all forms of the Japanese authorities' suppression of Chongryon, including unreasonable tax levy, and the police search for the Office of the Osaka Prefectural Korean Federation of Workers in Commerce in Japan and Koreans' houses and shops are a wanton violation of the DPRK-Japan Pyongyang Declaration and provocation to the desire of the two peoples for improved DPRK-Japan relations.
 The letter strongly urged Japan to immediately stop such moves as pursuing an object of hostility.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Mongolia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Mongolia 
    Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's famous work "On Some Questions in Understanding the Juche Philosophy" was brought out in booklet by a publishing house of Mongolia on April 1.
 The work, published on April 2, Juche 63 (1974), gives a new exposition of the basic character of the Juche philosophy, the Juche-oriented point of view on man, the Juche-oriented outlook on the world and the scientific understanding of independence. It also comprehensively clarifies the theoretical and practical problems arising in the development of the Juche philosophy.

146th Heaven Day of Chondoist Religion Marked
articles.content:
146th Heaven Day of Chondoist Religion Marked
    Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- A Heaven Day ceremony was held here today to mark the 146th anniversary of the foundation of the Chondoist Religion.
 Attending the ceremony were Ryu Mi Yong, chairwoman of the Korean Chondoist Church Central Guidance Committee, officials of the committee including O Ik Je and other Chondoists in the city. 
 The ceremony was held according to the rules of etiquette of the Chondoist Religion. Vice-Chairman of the Committee Kang Chol Won made an address at the ceremony. 
 He looked back on the history of the patriotic struggle waged by the Chondoists against foreign forces, noting that the Chondoist Religion came into being as a national religion holding aloft the banner of "rejection of the West and Japan" and "promotion of national interests and welfare of the people" at a time when a serious threat was posed to the aspiration of the Korean people after independence and the security of the country and the nation, the people who stood at the crossroads of life or death due to the tyranny of the corrupt feudal rule of the Ri Dynasty.    
 The Chondoists have covered the worthwhile and proud road of victory and glory through activities for the building of a new country and national reunification, he said, adding: This is ascribable to the ardent love of President Kim Il Sung, the great leader of the Korean nation, and leader Kim Jong Il, the lodestar of national reunification, for the fellow countrymen and their wise leadership.    
 He called upon the Chondoists in the north and the south to thoroughly implement the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration under the banner of "By our nation itself" so as to accelerate the reunification of the country, the greatest patriotic task before the nation, and take the lead in the patriotic movement for independent reunification, peace against war and overall national unity for the present.

articles.title: Pyongyang to Be Facelifted
articles.content:
Pyongyang to Be Facelifted
    Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Projects for building many objects and facelifting Pyongyang, capital city of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, are progressing apace this year.
 More than 50 objects and rural dwelling houses will be constructed and over 140 objects be repaired. Among them are the Ryongaksan Spring Water Factory, the Tudan Duck Farm and Kim Po Hyon University.    
 Main streets and several bridges in the city are being reconstructed to suit the demand of the modern times.    
 Factories under the Pyongyang Building-materials Complex have worked out plans to supply materials needed for projects for renovating the equipment of the Pyongyang Steel Plant and expanding tile production capacity of the Taesong Ceramic Factory.
 The Ryugyong Park in Pothonggang District, Pyongyang, will be built as a model to be generalized throughout the city. And more than 10,000 trees and over 80,000 flowering shrubs will be planted in parks, recreation grounds and green belts in the spring and autumn periods for the general mobilization of the land management.
 The districts and counties in the suburbs of the city are dynamically carrying on afforestation work in line with the general tree-planting plan of Pyongyang.
 Units including the Pyongyang Construction Guidance Bureau which are in charge of major construction objects have completed their blueprints suitable to the requirement of the Songun era and are undertaking the projects.
